yeezus.memory

Class MMU

  • java.lang.Object
    • yeezus.memory.MMU

  • public class MMU
extends java.lang.Object
    The MMU helps organize the RAM Memory in the yeezus Operating System. The MMU keeps track of which processes own which RAM addresses or blocks of addresses, and acts as the translator between logical and physical memory.
    Version:
    2.0
    Author:
    Mark Zeagler

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      MMU(Memory RAM)
      Constructs a new MMU around the given RAM.

      Checks if the given Process ID has any associated memory mappings in RAM.
      protected Word read(int physicalAddress)
      Reads the Word from the given physical address.
      Word read(PCB pcb, int logicalAddress)
      Reads the Word whose physical address corresponds to the given logical address for the given process.
      void terminateProcessMemory(PCB pcb)
      Un-maps the memory for a terminated process, freeing it up so that another can use it.

      Writes the given Word to the given physical address.

    • Constructor Detail

      • MMU

        public MMU(Memory RAM)
        Constructs a new MMU around the given RAM.
        Parameters:
        RAM - The RAM this MMU is meant to manage.

    • Method Detail

      • mapMemory

        public boolean mapMemory(PCB pcb)
        Maps the requested amount of memory in RAM to the given Process ID.
        Parameters:
        pcb - The PCB of the process to be mapped.
        Returns:
        true if the memory was successfully mapped for the process.

      • processMapped

        public boolean processMapped(PCB pcb)
        Checks if the given Process ID has any associated memory mappings in RAM.
        Parameters:
        pcb - The PCB of the memory mappings to be checked.
        Returns:
        true if the Process ID is associated with any memory mappings in RAM.

      • read

        protected Word read(int physicalAddress)
             throws InvalidAddressException
        Reads the Word from the given physical address.
        Parameters:
        physicalAddress - The physical address of the word to be read.
        Returns:
        The Word stored at the given physical address.
        Throws:
        InvalidAddressException - Thrown if the requested address is outside of the scope of the RAM.

      • read

        public Word read(PCB pcb,
                 int logicalAddress)
          throws InvalidAddressException
        Reads the Word whose physical address corresponds to the given logical address for the given process.
        Parameters:
        pcb - The PCB of the process whose memory is to be read.
        logicalAddress - The logical address for the given process.
        Returns:
        The Word stored in the physical location associated with the logical address of the given process.
        Throws:
        InvalidAddressException - Thrown if the logical address has not been mapped to a physical address.

      • write

        protected void write(int physicalAddress,
                     Word data)
              throws InvalidAddressException
        Writes the given Word to the given physical address.
        Parameters:
        physicalAddress - The physical location that is to be written to.
        data - The information that is to be stored.
        Throws:
        InvalidAddressException - Thrown if the requested address is outside of the scope of the RAM.

      • write

        public void write(PCB pcb,
                  int logicalAddress,
                  Word data)
           throws InvalidAddressException
        Writes the given word to the given logical address for the given process.
        Parameters:
        pcb - The PCB of the process whose memory is to be written to.
        logicalAddress - The logical address for the given process.
        data - The information that is to be stored.
        Throws:
        InvalidAddressException - Thrown if the logical address has not been mapped to a physical address.

      • terminateProcessMemory

        public void terminateProcessMemory(PCB pcb)
        Un-maps the memory for a terminated process, freeing it up so that another can use it.
        Parameters:
        pcb - The PCB of the process whose memory is to be freed.
